uk.ac.aber.dcs.cs12420.aberpizza.data

Class Till

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.aber.dcs.cs12420.aberpizza.data.Till

  • public class Till
extends java.lang.Object
    Main data class in the application that is used by GUI elements to control the Till. Used to represent the Till as a whole, and contains the array list of Orders that represent each customer order. Contains "system-wide" methods including creating a new order, generating reports and printing order receipts.
    Author:
    Connor Goddard (clg11)

      • setNewOrder

        public void setNewOrder(Order newOrder)
        Updates the newOrder object with a new order object.
        Parameters:
        newOrder - The updated newOrder object.

      • createNewOrder

        public void createNewOrder(java.lang.String custName)
        Creates a new customer order by initialising the 'newOrder' "template" object as a new Order. Sets the 'newOrder' customer name field to the string entered by the user via GUI.
        Parameters:
        custName - The customer name that the new order is for.

      • getNewOrder

        public Order getNewOrder()
        Gets the 'newOrder' object.
        Returns:
        The 'newOrder' object that represents the newly created order.

      • addOrder

        public void addOrder(Order order)
        Typically adds the 'newOrder' object to the 'orderArray' once the order has been finished. However any Order object can be added to the 'orderArray' using this method.
        Parameters:
        order - The Order object to be added to 'orderArray'

      • save

        public void save(java.lang.String filePath)
        Creates and calls the XML class to export the entire Till (this class) to XML before saving it to the file system.

      • load

        public static Till load(java.lang.String pathName)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Static method that allows a new Till object to be created containing data (such as an array of Orders) from an XML file. The method is static so that it can be accessed without a new instance of Till having to be created first.
        Parameters:
        pathName - The path name at which an acceptable XML file can be accessed
        Returns:
        The new Till object that contains data from XML file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred - Caught by GUI.

      • exportReceipt

        public void exportReceipt(java.lang.String dirPath,
                 boolean printReceipt)
        Creates a new instance of Receipt class and passes the array list of Order objects to export the bespoke order receipts.
        Parameters:
        dirPath - The file path of the new file that is to be saved/printed.
        printReceipt - Boolean defining if the new file is to be printed or not.

      • exportReport

        public void exportReport(java.lang.String filePath,
                java.net.URI pathURI,
                boolean printReport)
                  throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new instance of Report class and passes the array list of Order objects, and the calculated financial data to generate the 'end of day' till report.
        Parameters:
        filePath - The file path of the new file that is to be saved/printed.
        pathURI - The URI of the new fine (used to display in web browser)
        printReport - Boolean defining if the new file is to be printed or not.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • closeOrder

        public void closeOrder()
        Closes the current order by setting the 'newOrder' "template" object to null.

      • isOrderActive

        public java.lang.Boolean isOrderActive()
        Determines whether a new order has been created, or an order is currently being edited by checking if the 'newOrder' object is currently null or not.
        Returns:
        Whether 'newOrder' is currently active or not.
